meanings.definition: A wire stretched close to the ground that activates a mechanism when disturbed.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carefully placed tripwires around their camp to alert them of any intruders.
meanings.sent2: Be cautious in the forest, as tripwires may be hidden among the trees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought it would be funny to tie tripwires to the bird feeders.
meanings.sent4: In the game of life, we must navigate through various tripwires that can set us back.
meanings.sent5: The spy's mission was jeopardized when he accidentally triggered one of the tripwires.

meanings.definition: A potential source of danger or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Ignoring warning signs can lead you straight into tripwires of trouble.
meanings.sent2: She knew that entering the abandoned building was like walking into a field of tripwires.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can create tripwires in your schedule.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations were going smoothly until they hit a tripwire that caused tensions to rise.
meanings.sent5: His impulsive decisions often led him straight into the tripwires of consequences.
